alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 11:05PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Warm temperatures Sunday caused more high elevation snowmelt, and this water will make its way through area streams and rivers overnight and into the day Monday. Steady light to moderate rain is also causing streams and rivers to run high and fast. This will likely continue over the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated and are likely to overflow banks causing flooding in some areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM MDT, radar rainfall estimates suggest flooding may be occurring in the advisory area, as flood guidance has been surpassed over the past six hours. Additionally, high elevation snowmelt could be accelerated by rain falling. There are no river gauges in the Advisory area.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid setting up camp near streams or creeks.
